intro: Canthium congestiflorum, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
